result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory P. Brzozowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the premises of BP Ultimart, located in Poy Sippi, Wisconsin.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory P. Brzozowski

defendant.name: Brzozowski, Gregory P.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 07-19-2018 from MBP Builders, INC-as of June 29, 2018, Greg no longer works for MPB

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:33 AM: Defendant Gregory P. Brzozowski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Recommendation recited by ADA.  No claim for Rest.  Def confirms resolution.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater Enh attached dismissed by Court.   Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  5 mos WCJ - I/S -  S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  No contact with BP in Poy Sippi - Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge 60 DTP or PP - DNA Sample to be provided today.  Procedure for Expungement of DNA record explained to Def.  Appeal Rights Given.  2 days TS Credit.
from Defendant Re: Request to Reschedule P/S on 9/30/2015

Pre-trial conference at 09-10-2015 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-01-2015 10:30 am.

9:28 am case called.  Defendant Gregory P. Brzozowski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests counsel to be appointed as he does not qualify for SPD representation. Defendant requests to discuss matter with DA prior to seeking counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant Gregory P. Brzozowski in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:15 am.
